Car Track Days

A car track day is where you take your own car to a Circuit to drive it on the track. There are no restrictions on speed, but drivers are required to drive within their limits and abide by track regulations.

read more about Car Track Days

What happens on a car track day?

Circuit marshals monitor the events to ensure everyone on track is kept as safe as possible. You don't need any special sort of licence, but do require a full and valid driving licence. Most racing licences are also accepted. Most car track days run in an open pitlane format, where drivers can come on and off the track as they please. Sometimes car track days are run in groups, where drivers are split into beginner, intermediate and advanced ability and will take turns out on track. Usually in one 15 - 20 minute session per hour for each group. On most events you can have extra drivers and passengers, hire garages and helmets and also book a session of tuition.

Our Ranking System

To help you make your decision on which experiences to buy, our star ratings are based on a combination of popularity, price and content.

1 - 3 stars

Value experiences - great for low budgets but usually less drive-time than higher priced experiences. Usually limited to airfield type venues.

3 - 4 stars

Most popular experiences which have a good balance between price, itinerary and venue. Usually more drive-time and often better standard of venue than budget experiences.

5 stars

Top end, exclusive or rarest driving experiences with the best cars, best venues and the most amount of driving.
